title: At least 4 deaths in Houston , official says , as storms bring  life - threatening  flood risk to Texas and Louisiana
message:
At least 4 deaths in Houston as storms bring 'life-threatening' flood risk to Texas and LouisianaAt least four people are dead in Houston after hurricane-force winds and torrential rains tore a damaging path through the city Thursday.
Power outages left more than 1 million homes and businesses in the dark across the state on Thursday, with the torrential storms pounding an already-soaked South.
A few spots caught under multiple torrential storms may pick up 8 inches or more of rain.
Texas and Louisiana have been in the bull's-eye of seemingly unrelenting rounds of torrential, flooding downpours since the start of April.
A tornado warning had been issued earlier Thursday evening in Harris County, Texas, including downtown Houston, according to the National Weather Service.

title: Over 1 million power outages in Texas , most in Houston , as storms bring  life - threatening  flood risk to Texas and Louisiana
message:
Major flooding has prompted water rescues in at least one Texas city.
More than 200,000 are also without power in Louisiana as storms batter the state.
Possible tornadoes posed a risk in Texas and Louisiana, and carried the threat of destructive winds and golf ball-sized hail.
Texas and Louisiana have been in the bull’s-eye of seemingly unrelenting rounds of torrential, flooding downpours since the start of April.
A tornado warning had been issued earlier Thursday evening in Harris County, including downtown Houston, according to the National Weather Service.

title: Over 1 million power outages in Texas , most in Houston , as storms bring  life - threatening  flood risk to Texas and Louisiana
message:
At least 4 deaths in Houston, official says, as storms bring ‘life-threatening’ flood risk to Texas and LouisianaA forecast model shows one way storms could develop late Thursday in the South.
Texas and Louisiana have been in the bull’s-eye of seemingly unrelenting rounds of torrential, flooding downpours since the start of April.
A tornado warning had been issued earlier Thursday evening in Harris County, Texas, including downtown Houston, according to the National Weather Service.
Serious flash flooding is likely in any areas caught under multiple storms unloading 2 to 3 inches of rain per hour.
Earlier this month, nearly 2 feet of rain fell in just five days and sent parts of eastern Texas underwater.

title: At least 4 deaths in Houston , official says , as storms bring  life - threatening  flood risk to Texas and Louisiana
message:

Texas and Louisiana have been in the bull’s-eye of seemingly unrelenting rounds of torrential, flooding downpours since the start of April.

Serious flash flooding is likely in any areas caught under multiple storms unloading 2 to 3 inches of rain per hour.

title: High risk of extreme rainfall to trigger  life - threatening  flooding in Texas , Louisiana
message:
A dangerous, life-threatening flash flooding event is unfolding Thursday as torrential storms pound the already-soaked U.S. South.
A rare Level 4 of 4 high risk of excessive rainfall was issued for parts of eastern Texas and western Louisiana by the Weather Prediction Center Thursday.
Rainfall rates up to three inches per hour are possible in the heaviest storms, which could lead to life-threatening flash flooding, according to the WPC.
Serious flash flooding is likely in any areas caught under multiple storms unloading two to three inches of rain per hour.
An initial round of flash flooding is likely in the first half of Friday before rain starts to taper off in the afternoon.

title: Holdover wildfires : Why B . C . may see more overwinter fires flare up this season
message:
Here’s a closer look at what holdover fires are and their threat to Western Canada.
What are holdover fires?
When the conditions are right, fires burning deep underground can “slumber” undetected, simmering even under snow for possibly months after ignition.
Of the 130 active wildfires burning across the province on Tuesday, 85 were holdovers from the 2023 fire season, Budd said.
“We had very limited heat signatures until it started to become snow-free.”Tower said the depth of the holdover fires present another challenge, even when they are found.

title: Were in recovery mode : Storm kills 4 , Houston mayor asks Houstonians to stay home
message:
May 16, 2024: Trees down in Montrose and glass blown out at the Wells Fargo building in downtown Houston.
Firefighters were taking live wires off highways, the mayor said, urging people to stay away from downtown because of the glass and debris.
“It’s all hands on deck tonight,” Whitmire said.
May 16, 2024: Windows blown out near the Hyatt Regency in downtown Houston.
VIDEO appears to show funnel cloud in Cypress areaMay 16, 2024: Funnel cloud near Cypress.

title: At least four killed and more than one million without power as wild storm topples power lines , uproots trees and blows out high - rise windows in Houston
message:
At least four people have been killed after hurricane-force winds, life-threatening flooding and torrential rains destroyed the city of Houston, Texas, yesterday.
While the National Weather Service office issued a tornado warning for the city yesterday, it was winds reaching over 70 mph that toppled trees, blew out windows and left over a million people without power.
Houston Mayor John Whitmire said in a news conference that two people were killed by downed trees and a third died after a crane toppled over.
The Houston Fire Department has advised locals to leave their homes immediately and call 911 if they smell gas in their house.
The mayor has said it would take 24 to 48 hours for power to be restored in some areas.

title: April enigma - Newspaper - DAWN . COM
message:
Moving eastward, in April, southern China experienced over double the normal precipitation for the month, the second-highest level since 1961.
In early April, the Indus River System Authority (Irsa) predicted a 30 per cent water shortage in the early Kharif season.
(This was subsequently reversed after improved Kabul river flows.)
A flood of over 110,000 cusecs in the Kabul river augmented flows in the Indus zone.
By the end of April, the country received rainfall which was more than 150pc of the usual for the month.

title: Apprehension As Failed Edo N30bn Water Storm Project Escalates Flooding
message:
On a yearly basis, residents of such areas lose their property to the flooding, which in some cases leads to the loss of lives.
Despite the N30 billion water storm project embarked upon by the then administration of Comrade Adams Oshiomhole, the issue of flooding in some parts of the state capital has persisted.
Governor Godwin Obaseki in addressing flooding in the state had promised to complete the Benin water storm project initiated by his predecessor (Oshiomhole).
Igho lamented, “The main cause of this flooding in the area was as a result of the blockage of the moat and diversion of water from other areas.
He added that the state government would provide support to those displaced from their homes by the rising water level occasioned by flooding.

title: Four deaths confirmed from severe storm that ravaged Houston
message:
(Reuters) - A severe storm packing hurricane-force winds pummeled Houston on Thursday, killing at least four people, blowing windows out of high-rise buildings and leaving some 800,000 homes without power as much of the city was plunged into darkness, the mayor said.
The mayor said at least four storm-related fatalities had been confirmed, mostly from fallen trees.
Whitmire delivered similar initial storm assessments during a brief televised news conference carried live a short time after his interview.
The mayor said the severe weather had caught many residents by surprise, recounting that he was attending a little league baseball game when the storm hit, "and we had very little time to get to cover."
The National Weather Service also issued a flood watch for the Houston area from heavy rains associated with the storm.

title: Houston metro rocked by severe storms that left 4 dead and over 1 million without power
message:
HOUSTON - A line of severe thunderstorms swept through southeastern Texas and Louisiana on Thursday, blasting the Houston area with ferocious winds that left at least four dead and more than 1 million power customers without electricity.
The line of storms eventually raced east into Louisiana, pummeling New Orleans with gusts of 84 mph and leaving over 200,000 in Louisiana without power.
Local residents described the impacts of the storm as being hurricane-like despite the severe weather lasting less than an hour.
Ground stops were also issued at Bush Intercontinental Airport and Houston William P. Hobby Airport due to the severe weather.
Original article source: Houston metro rocked by severe storms that left 4 dead and over 1 million without power

title: Kona low brings bursts of rain and occasional sunny skies to disaster - weary Maui
message:
HONOLULU (HawaiiNewsNow) - A disaster-weary Maui braced Thursday for the potential of severe weather.
What they got was a mixed bag: Bursts of rain, strong winds and then sunny skies.
Amos Lonokailua-Hewett, administrator for Maui’s Emergency Management Agency, said county crews have been preparing for severe weather since last week.
But HNN spotted at least one canal near the intersection of South Kihei and North Kihei roads that had not been cleared.
In South Maui, meanwhile, the ocean was brown and choppy.

title: Govt moves to build temporary drainage on Kasoa road
message:
The Government is set to construct a temporary drainage as a matter of urgency on the Kasoa to Winneba section of the N1 to mitigate the flooding situation on that stretch.
The debris, he said, blocked the flow of water through the drains, and consequently resulted in flooding the area.
The Minister of Roads and Highways admitted that there was a serious storm drainage issue in the area.
The Kasoa Old Barrier area is notoriously prone to heavy vehicular traffic, a situation that gets exacerbated when it rains.
Run-off and soil washed from the hills onto the road took over one side of the dual carriage road, compelling commuters on opposite directions to use just the other side of the road.

title: Flooding could deluge the Gulf Coast after storms kill at least 4 , damage buildings and leave over 1 million without power
message:
At least four people died as the severe weather blasted through Houston, the mayor’s chief of communications Mary Benton told CNN.
The storm was so powerful that it blew out the windows of buildings in downtown Houston, littering the area with glass as traffic lights went dark.
Nearby, in College Station, videos shared with CNN on Thursday showed heavy rain flooding a park in the area.
CenterPoint Energy says its skyscraper in downtown Houston has sustained damage of the storm, according to a spokesperson.
He said there has been “extensive damage caused by these severe storms, historic river flooding, and tornadoes” that began on April 26.

Greg Abbott requested a presidential disaster declaration for areas of the state impacted by the recent onslaught of severe weather and flooding.
He said there has been “extensive damage caused by these severe storms, historic river flooding, and tornadoes” that began on April 26.

title: Orange County Fire Rescue receives 14 new boats , including solid hull vessels , inflatables
message:
WINDERMERE, Fla. - Orange County Fire Rescue (OCFR) has some essential new tools to save lives in the water.
They added 14 new boats to their rescue fleet.
"They travel together and basically give our rescuers options when it comes to a water rescue call," said Orange County Fire Rescue Lt. Brandon Allen.
OCFR said they planned to deploy these boats to stations throughout the county so that they could reach any water rescue site within ten minutes.
"Being able to have our ribs on top and have two boats respond from one location is efficient, and you can't really ask for more than that."

title: Canadian Oil Sands City Evacuated As Wildfire Draws Near
message:
Resident Ashley Russell was packed and ready to leave on a moment's notice, as the rest of the city was put on alert.“I'm experiencing a lot of anxiety.
“We're seeing extreme fire behaviour,” Alberta Wildfire spokeswoman Josee St-Onge told a news conference.
“We are confident that we have the resources to defend these areas, but we need people out of harm's way,” he said.
Canada is the world's fourth largest producer and a leading exporter of crude to the United States.
Rob Fraser, the mayor of Fort Nelson told AFP:“It's cool, it's overcast and the wind is just very slight.

title: Firefighters Gain Control of One Blaze Threatening Oil Sands in Alberta
message:
Firefighters gained control of one wildfire near the main oil-sands region of Alberta on Wednesday, but continued to battle a much larger blaze to the south that’s threatening the area’s biggest city.
Workers based in Fort McMurray help staff the surrounding oil-sands operations that produce the bulk of Canada’s 4.9 million barrels of daily crude output.
A devastating fire eight years ago leveled parts of Fort McMurray and forced the entire population to evacuate.
Photograph: A helicopter carrying water flies during sunset to fight fires in Fort McMurray, Alberta, Canada, in 2016.
Topics Energy Oil Gas

title: Houston Mayor Whitmire confirms at least four dead in powerful storm
message:
Brett Coomer/Staff photographerAt least four people died as a result of Thursday evening's powerful storm in Houston, according to Mayor John Whitmire's office.
A powerful thunderstorm tore over Houston starting around 6:30 p.m. bringing high winds and rain across wide swaths of the city.
It could take 48 hours for power to be restored throughout the city, Whitmire said.
Whitmire strongly urged people not to travel west through downtown Houston because of dangers of glass that had fallen from multiple skyscrapers.

title: Utah reservoir system returns to 90 %, but Cox says state message wont change
message:
About 95% of Utah's water supply comes from the snowpack collection and spring snowmelt process, which is captured at reservoirs.
Utah's system topped out at 86% capacity from last year's record snowpack after falling to 42% in late 2022 amid a long-term drought.
This map shows the capacity levels at dozens of Utah's reservoirs as of Thursday.
Utah's drought conditions drastically improved beginning last year.
Cox said if Utah's water consumption reduction patterns continue, the lake could be in for another boost next year even with an average snowpack.

title: FEMA Closes Disaster Recovery Centers in Rhode Island | News Radio 920 AM & 104 . 7 FM
message:
Following the severe storms and flooding that took place in December and January, three Disaster Recovery Centers (DRCs) have been open to assist Rhode Island residents in applying for FEMA assistance and uploading required documentsOn May 14, FEMA announced that the DRCs in Cumberland, Lincoln and Coventry are scheduled to close this week.
The DRCs at Coventry Town Hall Annex and the Community College of Rhode Island Lincoln Campus will be open through Saturday, May 18 until 4:30 pm.
To apply without visiting a center, register with FEMA in one of the following ways:Call 1-800-621-3362.
If you use video relay service (VRS), captioned telephone service or others, give FEMA your number for that service.
Online at DisasterAssistance.govOr download the FEMA Mobile App, available at Google Play or the Apple App StoreThe deadline to apply to FEMA is May 20, 2024.

title: Jefferson Parish opens shelter ahead of severe weather
message:
JEFFERSON PARISH, La.
(WGNO) — Jefferson Parish leaders have announced the parish’s preparations for anticipated severe weather on Thursday, May 16.
WGNO meteorologists announced a tornado watch is in effect for the Greater New Orleans area until 3 a.m. Friday.
They said the shelter will remain open until the National Weather Service “gives the all-clear that the storm has passed.”Residents planning to stay at the shelter should bring their own food and water.
New Orleans Inspector General makes recommendations for New Orleans East Hospital credit card proceduresParish officials are also advising residents to secure loose objects outside and stay inside, away from windows during severe weather conditions.

title: Riverside - Huntsville area residents face rising waters as more rain approaches amid flood recovery efforts
message:
Residents in the Riverside-Huntsville area brace for more rainfall while still grappling with the aftermath of the destructive floods two weeks prior.
FOX 26 STORM ALERT DAY: Tornado watch in effect until 10 pm ThursdayThe forecast predicted an additional 2–3 inches of rain on Thursday afternoon.
FOX 26 spoke with locals who expressed frustration over the difficulty of navigating their waterlogged streets.
FOX 26 Houston is now on the FOX LOCAL app available through Apple TV, Amazon FireTV, Roku and Google Android TV!
DOWNLOAD THE FOX 26 HOUSTON APP BY CLICKING HERELee Sterling, another impacted resident, prepares for what may come.

title: Safety suggestions from Marines to the public for Browns Island
message:
CAMP LEJEUNE, N.C. (WITN) - Camp Lejeune hosted a tour on Thursday to educate the public about safety on military property like Browns Island.
Browns Island is located on the northern side of Camp Lejeune.
The tour of Browns Island was an opportunity for Marines to talk about the dangers the public may face if they stay at the intracoastal waterway for too long.
“The island has been used since 1941 as a direct fire impact area, aerial gunnery and naval gunfire,” said Sgt.
The surrounding area of the island is open to the public, just not while training takes place.

title: Severe storms kill 4 , leave 900 , 000 without power in Houston
message:
Stay home, take care of your children,” Houston Mayor John Whitmire said in an evening briefing.
"Our first responders will be working around the clock.”The mayor said four people died during the severe weather.
Streets were flooded, and trees and power lines were down across the region.
The ferocious storms moved into neighboring Louisiana and left more than 215,000 customers without power.
About 900,000 customers were without electricity in and around Harris County, which contains Houston, according to poweroutage.us.

title: USS Ronald Reagan leaves its Japan home port after nearly 9 years | The Asahi Shimbun : Breaking News , Japan News and Analysis
message:
Family members and friends of the crew of the U.S. navy aircraft carriers USS Ronald Reagan (CVN-76) see off at the U.S. navy's Yokosuka base on May 16 in Yokosuka, south of Tokyo.
The departure of USS Ronald Reagan — one of America’s largest warships and a nuclear-powered Nimitz-class aircraft carrier — comes at a time of growing tension in the face of increasingly assertive China in the Indo-Pacific.
Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel ensured a “seamless transition.”“The USS Ronald Reagan and her crew have ensured that millions of people across the Indo-Pacific have been able to live their lives free of coercion, aggression and suppression,” Emanuel later told reporters.
USS Ronald Reagan first arrived in Yokosuka in 2015.
“We have a sense of urgency that we must not let the East China Sea become another South China Sea,” she said.

title: Severe storms kill at least 4 in Houston , knock out power to 900 , 000 homes and businesses
message:
Transmission power lines down in Cypress, Texas, after severe storms on May 16, 2024.
Stay home, take care of your children,” Houston Mayor John Whitmire said in an evening briefing.
Streets were flooded, and trees and power lines were down across the region.
About 900,000 customers were without electricity in and around Harris County, which contains Houston, according to poweroutage.us.
Heavy storms slammed the region during the first week of May, leading to numerous high-water rescues, including some from the rooftops of flooded homes.

title: Leon County Schools superintendent says storm damage for Florida capital city district could cost $8 to $10 million
message:
“I was not happy when I got up Friday morning,” Hanna candidly shared with the board.
Ultimately, LCS was forced to announce it would close around 9 a.m. Friday when many students were already on campus.
Hanna told the school board FEMA has been surveying damage at LCS sites as they assess the full scope of the storm’s impact in Leon County.
More Tallahassee news:Several board members recognized Hanna for his leadership and efforts throughout several major challenges.
“We’re a safety-first school district and you made the right calls, and they were hard,” chair Rosanne Wood said.

title: US Navy flagship carrier USS Ronald Reagan leaves its Japan home port after nearly 9 years
message:
Family members and friends of the crew of the U.S. navy aircraft carriers USS Ronald Reagan (CVN-76) see off at the U.S. navy's Yokosuka base Thursday, May 16, 2024, in Yokosuka, south of Tokyo.
The departure of USS Ronald Reagan — one of America’s largest warships and a nuclear-powered Nimitz-class aircraft carrier — comes at a time of growing tension in the face of increasingly assertive China in the Indo-Pacific.
The carrier was accompanied by two guided-missile destroyers, USS Robert Smalls and USS Howard.
USS Ronald Reagan first arrived in Yokosuka in 2015.
“We have a sense of urgency that we must not let the East China Sea become another South China Sea,” she said.

title: Investors abandon bullish case for US petrol
message:
Just over a month ago, investors had amassed one of the largest bullish positions in US petrol futures and options since before the pandemic, anticipating that prices would continue climbing.
Second-month US petrol futures prices have recently traded US$21 per barrel above front-month Brent, with the premium down from more than US$28 in the middle of March.
Investors have noticed and liquidated many of the bullish long positions in petrol futures and options they had amassed by early April.
As a result, fund managers’ net position was cut to 49 million barrels (41st percentile for all weeks since 2013) on May 7 from 85 million barrels (88th percentile) four weeks earlier.
The hedge fund community had a neutral or even slightly bearish outlook on petrol prices having been strongly bullish just a month before.

title: USS Ronald Reagan Leaves Its Japan Home Port after Nearly 9 Years
message:
The departure of USS Ronald Reagan — one of America’s largest warships and a nuclear-powered Nimitz-class aircraft carrier — comes at a time of growing tension in the face of increasingly assertive China in the Indo-Pacific.
It will be replaced later this year by USS George Washington, another Nimitz-class carrier, now on assignment near South America.
Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel ensured a “seamless transition.”“The USS Ronald Reagan and her crew have ensured that millions of people across the Indo-Pacific have been able to live their lives free of coercion, aggression and suppression,” Emanuel later told reporters.
USS Ronald Reagan first arrived in Yokosuka in 2015.
“We have a sense of urgency that we must not let the East China Sea become another South China Sea,” she said.
